summary: This document is an email chain between the chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan and attorneys involved in United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It concerns the submission and confirmation of a corrected, temporarily sealed memo endorsement related to a Rule 17(c) subpoena. The communication is between the judge's chambers, defense counsel, and other legal representatives.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). Her chambers are sending and receiving the correspondence regarding a sealed memo endorsement.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell, in the case. She confirms receipt of the court's memo endorsement via email.

persons.name: Brian Burns
persons.context: Attorney from Smith Villazor LLP who submits a letter from Patrick J. Smith to the court regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Patrick J. Smith
persons.context: Attorney whose letter regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena is being submitted to the court by Brian Burns in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, likely involved as counsel in the United States v. Maxwell case.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence, likely involved as counsel in the United States v. Maxwell case.

connections.description: Defense attorney communicating with the presiding judge's chambers regarding court filings in United States v. Maxwell.
Attorney Brian Burns is submitting a letter to the court on behalf of attorney Patrick J. Smith regarding a legal matter in the case.
Attorney submitting a legal filing to the judge's chambers in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Submission of Rule 17(c) Subpoena Letter
events.description: Attorney Brian Burns submits a letter from Patrick J. Smith to Judge Nathan's chambers regarding a Rule 17(c) subpoena in the United States v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Issuance of Sealed Memo Endorsement
events.description: Judge Nathan issues a temporarily sealed memo endorsement related to the case, which is sent to counsel by her chambers.

events.title: Correction and Confirmation of Memo
events.description: Judge Nathan's chambers send a corrected version of the memo endorsement and request confirmation of receipt from counsel.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain regarding court filings in the criminal case United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
A temporarily sealed memo endorsement was issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan on November 15, 2021, and a corrected version was sent on November 16, 2021.
Attorney Brian Burns submitted a letter from Patrick J. Smith to the court concerning a Rule 17(c) subpoena.
Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim, representing Ghislaine Maxwell, confirmed receipt of the court's communication.
The correspondence highlights procedural legal activity and communication between the court and counsel in the Maxwell case.
